page.title: 11Health Hospitals and Doctors
page.content: The people of Iwade, Kemsley and Bobbing have to travel into Sittingbourne or Milton to see a doctor as there are no surguries in any of these villages.This residents find alarming as doctors do not seem very keen to come out on home visits. To take a child from Iwade to Sittingbourne to see a doctor will cost a mother Â£1.50 on the bus. They will leave at 10am and not get back until 1pm. In an emergency the nearest hospital is nine miles away, and for people visiting these hospitals the distance can provevery daunting and inconvenient. The Dentists can be consulted in Sittingbourne but appointments are not easy to get in an emergency and for adults treatment is now quite expensive.
